title: ahri didn't need a skin so bad,but if you really wanted to give her one...
body:
why another pop/idol skin?

she already have a pop star skin,why did you make another one which is basically a better chroma?

i mean the skin looks good from the art but she already had one with this theme...
there are many skin lines where she would have fit better (pool party,blood moon,soulstealer...) but this one was so unneded

replies.body:
With rumors that Black Pink, a K-Pop group, is doing the World's Theme - did anyone consider that the 4 girls in the band selected these champions for this skin line?

Also, this is nowhere remotely close to the old Pop Star Ahri. Not even in the same time zone. I don't know why people keep thinking they're the exact same thing when they are QUITE CLEARLY NOT.

Because they basically envelop the same thematic of K-popstar?

It's like you give Yorick his Pentakill skin, then give him another Rock and Roll Skin that's a different Genre of Rock (let's say Punk or Grunge).  While they are two different kinds of Rock and Roll, you still basically made two Rockstar skins for Yorick.  Which seems redundant.
Pentakill is metal, not rock n roll.  Big difference.  That’s like saying jazz is ragtime or something.
Yes, but you see the point?  They will envelop the same idea, with only minor differences.

Sona is a musician in her classic skin. Yet she has a skin where she's got a guqin, she's got Pentakill where she's a different kind of musician, and she's got DJ Sona, where she's a DJ. Should Sona never get musically based skins because she encompasses the same idea as some of them in her base skin?

Sona at her base is a musician, her champion theme is a musician.  Ergo, all her skins have a base musician feel.  This is literally how skins work, they take the baseline theme of the champion and put them in another setting.  We have exceptions, but those are **exceptions** not the rule.
You glossed over my first point entirely - did you consider that the girls in the band Black Pink selected the champions?
I did not.  Even so, I feel that there should have been some restraint there.

Really? If this line is in any way linked to World's in Korea, and the K-Pop band Black Pink, why on this earth would the very champion based on a Korean mythical being, influenced heavily by Korean aesthetics and dances with her animations somehow NOT be able to take part in something so wholly connected to the country her very origin is based off of?
Because we already have a skin for her that does that exact thing.  It's called Popstar Ahri.

This wouldn't be an issue of whether or not she has a similar skin. This would be an issue of whether or not she's in a potential skin line that's commemorating the Korean hosting of World's this year. This is all theoretical, of course, but IF this new line is made specifically to commemorate Black Pink and Korea, Ahri needs to be a part.

> [{quoted}](name=Oleandervine,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Rv05h5Nd,comment-id=0000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2018-09-25T15:36:48.842+0000)

This is all theoretical, of course, but IF this new line is made specifically to commemorate Black Pink and Korea, Ahri needs to be a part.

No, that is the issue I have with the skin.  That is the main problem I believe anyone will have with the skin (of course, I am probably wrong).  And even if we are talking about culture (which let's not because Ninja's are from Japan and from my understanding, Japan and Korea really don't get along) I still think it wasn't the best idea for Ahri to get another popstar skin.  If she didn't have a popstar skin, then this would be perfect.  But she does, and it ruins spots for other people.

It doesn't ruin the spot because NO OTHER CHAMPION has ties to Korean mythology and culture like Ahri. Not including Ahri in a Korean based skin line would be a pretty big affront if you ask me, especially if it's in commemoration of something to do with World's in Korea (if this is the case with this line). So I have no problem with Ahri in this skin line if this is the case.
If this isn't the case, I _still_ have no problem with her in this skin line because it deviates heavily in nature to her old Pop Star skin.

Tfw {{champion:78}} has 2 xmas skins.

I'm sure if I waste anymore time I can find more skins that have the same theme in old champs but the point is Riot does not give a shit. If it sells then it sells, and sometimes they have no choice in who gets the skins.

I'll give you everything except steel legion and commando.  Those skin lines are distinct enough to act as separate skin lines because one focuses on more modern military while the other focuses on future/warhammer like settings.

And I'd also argue against Poppy because while Ragdoll was released as a Christmas one, the skin itself is more of a toy than Christmas themed.

Two military skins is fine as long as they focus on different sub-themes of military, then?

So why not two distinct sub-sets of popstar?
Iron Legion is basically a futertech universe.  It's not another subgenre of the same music like the K-pop skin is.

This basically comes down to a simple statement: 

If it is a theme I am interested in, multiple takes on it from different sub-genres are fine. If it is one I am not interested in, then it is not fine.

Which is why we have people in this thread who are fans of the theme saying it's fine, and people who aren't saying it's not.

With that being established... and the realization that this was picked BY THE PEOPLE IN THE GROUP THEMSELVES(who probably don't care what other skins the champ has)... can we stop the needless complaining?
People will complain regardless. But I have made my point.

Another example.

Don't degrade punk like that headass

Who're ya, talking like you appreciate punk music, yet trying to defend it?

The whole point of the punk music is to give a beeg middle finger to all other musical genres. Johnny Rotten from the Sex Pistols couldn't sing, nor had he any idea what to wear for his concerts, or what haircut he should get; so he shouted, wore anything that looked bad enough to provoke the public, and (the myth says) he asked a drunk and high squat comrade to do whatever he liked with the scissors.

The whole idea of the punk movement, as I understand it, is to degrade looks, music, painting, anything that is conceived as having any value, into something that has none. You take lyrics, you strip them of what regular people deem likeable, add provocation and swears, slap derailed notes and stuff onto it and you call it a "song". Call it active nihilism if you like. Therefore your claim is irrelevant, and these whole boards are just a pile of garbage waiting to be set aflame.

The point of punk is not to degrade other music, art, or anything of the sort. The punk movement started as a fuck you to the government and norms forced on society at the time in an artistic rebellion. It is meant so express individuality and anti-establishment of societal values. Literally every punk song from the original era will have lyrics describing this. You could literally look at a wiki on punk and see this. Don't lecture someone if you don't even know the history of what you are lecturing over. Seriously atleast google to fact check yourself first. {{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

Ok. No.

Classic punk like the dead Kennedys were very politically charged while a band like the Ramones wanted to get away from the general rock n roll. The sex pistols' style was a predecessor to the hardcore and street punk styles. 

Early on drug use, social politics and the culture itself became topics. 

Punk rock's topics range from all that and (teenage) anxiety, average troubles in life and even just fucking around and having fun became more prevalent.

Nihilism is prevalent in the culture in all it's forms and is just a basic feeling of the world being shit. 

Another topic that comes up In most forms is unity.

Sticking it to the Man ain't everything you know.

Punk is a genre that's seen a lot of evolution and sadly not everyone is willing to accept that.
